title: Rear Sprocket Carrier and Cush Drive - Installation

body.body: Rear Sprocket Carrier and Cush Drive - Installation
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Caution - Wheels - Do not rest on brake disc
Do not allow the wheel to rest on the brake disc, as this may damage the disc. Support the wheel on wooden blocks, equally spaced around the rim, such that the brake disc is raised above the ground.
Install the cush drive rubbers to the wheel hub.
Fit the spacer to the wheel hub as noted for removal.
Refit the sprocket carrier to the wheel.

Refit the rear wheel D34; D54; D64; D72; D92; DA2; DB; DB2; DBX; DC; DC3; DC4; DCZ; DD2; DD4; DE; DE2; DEX; DF; DF2; DF4; DG4; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPZ; DPA; DT3; DU; DU3; DUY; DW4; DX4; DZ; DZA; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DCZ; DPZ; D34; DX4; DW4; DD4; D64; D54; DP4; DC4; D72; D92; DG4; DF4; DU3; DT3; DEX; DD2; DF2; DF; DE2; DE; DUY; DU; DC3; DC; DZA; DZ; DA2; DBX; DB2; DB; DP3; DP2; DPA; DP
